text:
WhatsApp for Android Gets Fingerprint Scanner Support
01 Nov 2019, 07:10 by Victor Podvolotsky
The function is already available to all users. Just update the app.
The WhatsApp messenger for Android finally has support for the fingerprint scanner, which was previously only available in the beta version of the application. To enable the function, go to Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Privacy ‚Üí Fingerprint lock.






To activate the function, at least one fingerprint must be registered in the system. If WhatsApp detects it, it will allow you to configure the application lock time and content display.
The function is already available to all users. If you did not find it in the settings, update the application to the latest version via Google Play.
Google Play WhatsApp Messenger Developer: WhatsApp Inc. Price: Free
Earlier this year, Face ID or Touch ID support appeared in the iOS version of the application.
